terms.definition: Search Engine Optimization - the practice of improving website visibility and ranking in search engine results through various techniques and optimizations
The user-friendly, readable part of a URL that describes the page content, typically appearing after the domain name and helping with SEO and navigation
Structured data code added to web pages that helps search engines understand content context and display rich snippets in search results
A centralized web platform that hosts and organizes technical documentation, user guides, and knowledge base articles for easy access and navigation
Search Engine Results Page - the page displayed by search engines in response to a user's query, showing ranked results and snippets
The process of adapting content and software for specific languages, regions, or cultures to make it accessible to global audiences
Organized information formatted in a standardized way that search engines can easily understand and process to enhance search results
HTML attributes that provide brief summaries of web page content, appearing in search results and helping with SEO and accessibility
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing multiple versions to coexist and preventing content conflicts
Folder structures within a website's URL path that organize content hierarchically, affecting SEO and site architecture
Prefixes added to a main domain name to create separate sections of a website, often used for organizing different types of content
Enhanced search results that display additional information like ratings, images, or structured data beyond the standard title and description
Website visitors who arrive through unpaid search engine results rather than through paid advertisements or direct links
The percentage of users who click on a specific link or search result after seeing it, used as a metric for content effectiveness
The process by which search engines systematically browse and index web pages to understand their content and structure
